# NSMeasurement

**Class**

A numeric quantity labeled with a unit of measure, with support for unit conversion and unit-aware calculations.

## Declaration

```swift
class NSMeasurement
```

## Overview

Use this object in Swift when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.

An [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMeasurement] object represents a quantity and unit of measure. The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMeasurement] class provides a programmatic interface to converting measurements into different units, as well as calculating the sum or difference between two measurements.

[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMeasurement] objects are initialized with an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Unit] object and `double` value. [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMeasurement] objects are immutable, and cannot be changed after being created.

You can use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/MeasurementFormatter] class to create localized string representations of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMeasurement] objects.



## Creating Measurements

- **init(doubleValue:unit:)**: Initializes a new measurement with a specified double-precision floating-point value and unit.

## Accessing Unit and Value

- **unit**: The unit of measure.
- **doubleValue**: The measurement value, represented as a double-precision floating-point number.

## Converting to Other Units

- **canBeConverted(to:)**: Indicates whether the measurement can be converted to the given unit.
- **converting(to:)**: Returns a measurement created by converting the receiver to the specified unit.

## Operating on Measurements

- **adding(_:)**: Returns a new measurement by adding the receiver to the specified measurement.
- **subtracting(_:)**: Returns a new measurement by subtracting the specified measurement from the receiver.

## Essentials

- **Measurement**: A numeric quantity labeled with a unit of measure, with support for unit conversion and unit-aware calculations.
- **Unit**: An abstract class representing a unit of measure.
- **Dimension**: An abstract class representing a dimensional unit of measure.
